components.description:
A yellow face with open eyes, raised eyebrows, and an open mouth, as if gasping in shock or surprise. Often depicted showing its upper teeth. May convey a wide range of emotions, including awe, amazement, admiration, disbelief, excitement, or concern.

Similar to ðŸ˜¯ Hushed Face, which features smaller eyes and mouth. Several earlier designs, including Apple’s, displayed X-shaped eyes, making the emoji resemble ðŸ˜µ Dizzy Face. Google’s design previously depicted a wobbly expression, as if inebriated.

Huawei's design for this emoji includes a ðŸ’¥ Collision-like symbol behind its head, emphasising its astonishment.
components.title: Astonished Face

title: Astonished Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.definition: An astonished face, with a wide open mouth, gasping in shock or surprise. The Google artwork for this emoji looks slightly inebriated, with  http://emojipedia.org/astonished-face/
emoji_net_data.name: astonished face

bn:00086897v: Reject as false; refuse to accept

bn:00028425n: Doubt, a status between belief and disbelief, involves uncertainty or distrust or lack of sureness of an alleged fact, an action, a motive, or a decision.
Doubt is uncertainty in the context of trust, action, decision or belief.
